page.title: 01General description.
page.content: This area, south east of Street is dissected by a dominant ridge. To the south of this there is a striking slope. The main road runs from Ashcott to King Weston. The other principal road runs from Street to Somerton through Compton Dundon,recently this has become more widely used by lorries as a link between the A303 and the M5 The other major settlement to the east is Butleigh. A large proportion of the hills and their dip slopes are covered in decidious woodland and, more recently, conifer plantations. Dundon Hill in the south west corner stands out with its iron-age hill fort. The most striking feature of the whole area is the Hood monument overlooking Compton Dundon. Both the undulating land to the north of the ridge and the flat plains to the south are very prosperous agriculturally.
